page.title: 10The Woodland and Animals
page.content: There are many trees in our area.Most are in woods but there are many in fields and along hedgerows.The Godinton Park estate surrounding the house is traditional parkland,of pasture with scattered trees and areas of woodland.The most common trees are oak,ash,horse chestnut,alder,hawthorn and elm.These are all deciduous trees but some coniferous trees have been planted. Most of the wild animals live in the woods because there is plenty of cover.We saw a lot of action with the small mammals running away,such as field mice,rabbits and squirrels.There are also foxes.We have a few pets like cats and dogs.The farm animals are mostly sheep and cattle.This area has good pasture for farm animals and plenty of food and cover for wild amimals.
